CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band .

Let's think step by step.

1. DSeBT: This is a specific material name mentioned in the paragraph. It is likely a type of donor-acceptor polymer used in the construction of Perovskite Solar Cells (PSCs).
2. PSCs: Perovskite Solar Cells is a type of solar cell technology. It is not a material itself but a technology that uses certain materials to function.
3. HOMO: Hole Orbital Magnitude is a material property, specifically the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) in a material.
4. LUMO: Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital is a material property, specifically the energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) in a material.
5. Donor (D) and acceptor (A) polymers: These are types of materials used in the construction of PSCs. The donor material provides electrons, while the acceptor material accepts electrons.

So, the material names in the paragraph are DSeBT, donor polymers, and acceptor polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

The material names in the paragraph are:

1. DSeBT
2. Donor polymers
3. Acceptor polymers

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DSeBT |
| Donor polymers |
| Acceptor polymers |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band .

Let's think step by step.

1. DSeBT: This is a specific type of donor-acceptor polymer. It can be considered as a compound or material property.
2. PSCs: This stands for Perovskite Solar Cells. It is a type of solar cell.
3. J SC: This stands for Short-Circuit Current Density, which is a property of a solar cell.
4. V OC: This stands for Open-Circuit Voltage, which is a property of a solar cell.
5. LUMO: This stands for Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital, which is a molecular property of the donor-acceptor polymers.
6. HOMO: This stands for Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital, which is a molecular property of the donor-acceptor polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. DSeBT: This is a specific type of donor-acceptor polymer.
2. HOMO: This stands for Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital, which is a molecular property of the donor-acceptor polymers.
3. LUMO: This stands for Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital, which is a molecular property of the donor-acceptor polymers.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| DSeBT (donor-acceptor polymer) |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band .

Let's think step by step.

1. Higher J SC values: This is a property related to the current density in photovoltaic cells (PSCs). J SC stands for the short-circuit current density.
2. V OC values: This is a property related to the voltage output of photovoltaic cells. VOC stands for the open-circuit voltage.
3. DSeBT: This is a specific type of donor-acceptor polymer used in the study.
4. LUMO: This stands for the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital, which is a property related to the energy level of the acceptor in the donor-acceptor polymer.
5. HOMO: This stands for the highest occupied molecular orbital, which is a property related to the energy level of the donor in the donor-acceptor polymer.
6. PSCs: This stands for polymer solar cells.
7. Absorption band: This is a property related to the range of wavelengths of light that a material can absorb. In this context, it refers to the broadening of the absorption band in the donor-acceptor polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Higher J SC values: This is a property related to the current density in photovoltaic cells. J SC stands for the short-circuit current density.
2. V OC values: This is a property related to the voltage output of photovoltaic cells. VOC stands for the open-circuit voltage.
3. LUMO energy level: This is a property related to the energy level of the acceptor in the donor-acceptor polymer.
4. Absorption band: This is a property related to the range of wavelengths of light that the material can absorb. In this context, it refers to the broadening of the absorption band in the donor-acceptor polymers.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Higher J SC values (short-circuit current density in photovoltaic cells) |
| V OC values (open-circuit voltage in photovoltaic cells) |
| LUMO energy level (energy level of the acceptor in donor-acceptor polymers) |
| Broadened absorption band (range of wavelengths of light that the donor-acceptor polymers can absorb) |
